title: Cross-Registry Integrity & Consistency Audit
scope: Cross-registry relationships, key consistency, supplementary registries

cross_registry_relationships.material_to_tools: Material ISO group → compatible tool coatings/geometries via crossLookup()
cross_registry_relationships.material_to_coolants: Material properties (heat sensitivity, reactivity) → coolant recommendations
cross_registry_relationships.machine_to_alarms: Machine controller family → AlarmRegistry controller index
cross_registry_relationships.machine_to_post_processors: Machine controller → PostProcessorRegistry for G-code generation
cross_registry_relationships.tool_to_geometry: Tool type → ToolGeometryDefaults for default dimensions

key_consistency.iso_group_keys: P/M/K/N/S/H/X used consistently across Material, Coating, and SFC calculations
key_consistency.controller_families: 12 families consistent between Machine, Alarm, and PostProcessor registries
key_consistency.tool_types: Tool type taxonomy consistent between Tool, ToolGeometry, and SFC registries
key_consistency.machine_types: Machine type taxonomy consistent between Machine, MachineSpindle, and capacity planning

supplementary_registry_audits.quality: HIGH — SFC performance factors, ISO group compatibility matrix, temperature ratings
HIGH — environmental tracking (VOC, pH, disposal), pressure ratings, material compatibility
HIGH — 3-tier fuzzy matching (exact → partial → category), ISO 13399 attribute mapping
HIGH — torque/power estimation curves, speed ranges, bearing type tracking
MEDIUM — thin wrapper over DB_MANIFEST.json, minimal validation
HIGH — hybrid inline+filesystem, relevance scoring, domain classification
HIGH — SAFETY CRITICAL: G-code formatting rules per controller family

findings.finding: ISO group keys (P/M/K/N/S/H/X) consistent across Material, Coating, and SFC registries
Controller family taxonomy consistent across Machine, Alarm, and PostProcessor registries
crossLookup() correctly bridges Material → Tool/Coating/Coolant relationships
ToolGeometryDefaults 3-tier fuzzy matching provides graceful degradation for unknown tool types
PostProcessorRegistry correctly flagged as SAFETY CRITICAL (incorrect G-code = crash risk)
KnowledgeBaseRegistry has 1 stub entry (kb-ai-structures) with enabled=true — stub should be disabled or implemented
DatabaseRegistry is thin wrapper with minimal validation — acceptable for internal use
15 registries total managed by registryManager — comprehensive coverage of manufacturing domain
